reviews.review_msg: I love her reading list. Dr Kim gave many useful suggestions on essays. But she is also a tough grader. She didn't make me feel tired of a four-hour lecture.

She is an unfair marker who tells you one thing and marks another way.  Her concept of Diaspora is restrictive.  She does not negotiate the issues around this topic; rather you learn to regurgitate back her perspective.  She?s also not interested in current research despite the extensive discussion around the issue in Engl Lit.
the class was mostly discussion, but if you read the books, you'll enjoy it! she is really helpful in giving feedback and is a fair marker.

Hi all. This is by far the best class I've taken at SFU. I agree  with the comment that she's young and fresh, opening my world to new experiences. To the person with the negative comments, it was probably you that was being disrespectful in class and if she cut you off in any way, we were all thinking it!

One on one:very approachable, nice,willing to help.I liked her sense of humor.Class topic discussions relied on ALOT of articles w/novels assigned.Didnt articulate article themes for class understanding well.DOES NOT LECTURE.Discussions are the class means of obtaining information.Time management:student presentations too long/short class goes late

ck is young + fresh. understandably she is new and needs to work out kinks in her teaching style. while discussions take up whole class, should find ways to be more stimulating (she should stand up + walk around, do more group work, put key points on board). also needs to watch time during presentations + for breaks. overall ck is good, not great.

I was hoping for a better prof for the money that I put into tuition though such high hopes sometimes are not achievable. Christine seems to lack the ability to present her ideas in a way that is easy to understand. Instead she seems to speak in circles where one idea leads to the next which leads to another which is when I lose track of the topic.

Christine is, indeed, very unprofessional. A prof should never stoop to the level of pettiness and immaturity that the class may be exhibiting and join in on the smirking at and ostracizing of another student, no matter how silly that student's contributions may be. Course lacks fresh content, direction--spiraled into reiteration of first topics.
Whoever wrote the previous comment is ill informing you all..  Christine is a great prof. and IF you were cut off, it was for a good reason and I am positive the rest of the class was greatful!
paul is awesome...really funny and totally knows his stuff.  hes really nice and genuinely cares about his students.  take a class with him if you can.
coolest male feminist i've ever known - a great prof and an inspiration
